content.question: The radius of a right circular cylinder is increasing at a rate of <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units per second. The height of the cylinder is decreasing at a rate of <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units per second. Which of the following expressions gives the rate at which the volume of the cylinder is changing with respect to time in terms of the radius <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the cylinder? (The volume <math alttext="V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of a cylinder with radius <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="V equals, pi times r squared, times h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi><msup><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.)

choices.label: <math alttext="4 pi r h, minus 5 pi times r squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>h</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi><msup><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4 pi r h, plus 5 pi times r squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi><msup><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4 pi r h, minus 5 pi times r squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>h</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi><msup><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>
